title: CVPR_2004_18_abs

sentences.text: The automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts requires shape information since low-level feature analysis alone often fails to reach this goal .
We introduce a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation which is based on mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture as well as probabilistic shape knowledge .
The combined approach is formulated in the framework of Bayesian statistics to account for the robust-ness requirement in image understanding .
Experimental evidence shows that semantically meaningful segments are inferred , even when image data alone gives rise to ambiguous segmentations .

Entity-novel_method_of_shape_constrained.label: novel method of shape constrained image segmentation
aliases: a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation
novel method of shape constrained image segmentation
Entity-novel_method_of_shape_constrained.description: A novel method of shape constrained image segmentation that utilizes mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture, along with probabilistic shape knowledge, formulated within a Bayesian statistical framework to enhance the robustness of image segmentation.

mentions.local_name: novel method of shape constrained image segmentation
a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation

Entity-method.label: method
Entity-method.description: The method refers to a novel approach for shape constrained image segmentation that utilizes mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture, along with probabilistic shape knowledge, formulated within a Bayesian statistical framework.

Entity-combined_approach.label: combined approach
Entity-combined_approach.description: The combined approach refers to a methodology for shape constrained image segmentation that integrates mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture with probabilistic shape knowledge, formulated within a Bayesian statistics framework to enhance robustness in image understanding.

Entity-shape_constrained_image_segmentat.label: shape constrained image segmentation
Entity-shape_constrained_image_segmentat.description: Shape constrained image segmentation is an image processing technique that incorporates geometric constraints to improve the accuracy of segmenting objects within images based on their shapes and features.

Entity-the_automated_segmentation_of_ima.label: The automated segmentation of images
Entity-the_automated_segmentation_of_ima.description: The automated segmentation of images refers to the process of dividing an image into distinct regions or segments that correspond to meaningful parts, utilizing shape information and advanced statistical methods to enhance accuracy beyond low-level feature analysis.

Entity-semantically_meaningful_segment.label: semantically meaningful segments
Entity-semantically_meaningful_segment.description: Semantically meaningful segments refer to distinct parts of an image that are identified through a combination of shape information and feature distributions, allowing for a more accurate interpretation of the image's content despite potential ambiguities in the data.

Entity-probabilistic_shape_knowledge.label: probabilistic shape knowledge
Entity-probabilistic_shape_knowledge.description: Probabilistic shape knowledge refers to a statistical representation of shape information used in image segmentation, which integrates feature distributions for color and texture to enhance the understanding of semantically meaningful segments in images.

Entity-ambiguous_segmentation.label: ambiguous segmentations
Entity-ambiguous_segmentation.description: Ambiguous segmentations refer to the uncertainty or lack of clarity in the automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts, particularly when low-level feature analysis fails to provide definitive results.

Entity-automated_segmentation.label: automated segmentation
Entity-automated_segmentation.description: Automated segmentation is a method in image processing that involves the use of algorithms to divide an image into distinct regions or segments based on specific criteria, often to facilitate analysis or interpretation.

Entity-image.label: images
Entity-image.description: The term 'images' refers to visual data that is subject to automated segmentation into semantically meaningful parts, utilizing shape information and feature analysis in the context of image understanding.

Entity-mixture_of_feature_distribution_f.label: mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture
aliases: mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture
Entity-mixture_of_feature_distribution_f.description: Mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture refer to a statistical approach used in image segmentation that combines various color and texture features to enhance the identification of semantically meaningful segments in images, particularly when integrated with shape information and Bayesian methods.

mentions.local_name: mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture

Entity-color_and_texture.label: color and texture
Entity-color_and_texture.description: The term 'color and texture' refers to the combined low-level visual features used in a novel method for shape constrained image segmentation, which utilizes mixtures of feature distributions to enhance the understanding of semantically meaningful segments in images.

Entity-semantically_meaningful_part.label: semantically meaningful parts
Entity-semantically_meaningful_part.description: Semantically meaningful parts refer to distinct segments of an image that are identified based on their shape, color, and texture, which contribute to a coherent understanding of the image's content.

Entity-shape_information.label: shape information
Entity-shape_information.description: Shape information refers to the data and characteristics related to the geometric structure of objects in images, which is essential for accurately segmenting images into meaningful parts beyond what low-level features can achieve.

Entity-color.label: color
Entity-color.description: In the context of image segmentation, 'color' refers to a visual feature that is utilized in conjunction with texture and shape information to enhance the accuracy of segmenting images into semantically meaningful parts.

Entity-goal.label: goal
Entity-goal.description: The term 'goal' refers to the objective of achieving effective automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts, which is hindered by the limitations of low-level feature analysis.

Entity-this_goal.label: this goal
Entity-this_goal.description: The term 'this goal' refers to the successful automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts, which is hindered by the limitations of low-level feature analysis.

Entity-texture.label: texture
Entity-texture.description: In the context of image segmentation, 'texture' refers to a visual feature that characterizes the surface quality and patterns of an image, which is utilized alongside color information to enhance the segmentation process.

Entity-low-level_feature_analysis.label: low-level feature analysis
Entity-low-level_feature_analysis.description: Low-level feature analysis refers to the process of extracting basic visual features from images, such as edges, colors, and textures, which serve as foundational elements for more complex image processing tasks.

Entity-image_understanding.label: image understanding
Entity-image_understanding.description: Image understanding is a subfield of computer vision that focuses on the interpretation and analysis of visual data from the world, enabling machines to comprehend and derive meaning from images.

Entity-mixture_of_feature_distribution.label: mixtures of feature distributions
Entity-mixture_of_feature_distribution.description: Mixtures of feature distributions refer to a statistical model that combines multiple probability distributions to represent the variability of features in a dataset, often used in machine learning and data analysis to capture complex patterns in data.

Entity-bayesian_statistic.label: Bayesian statistics
Entity-bayesian_statistic.description: Bayesian statistics is a statistical framework that applies Bayes' theorem to update the probability of a hypothesis as more evidence or information becomes available.

Entity-image_data.label: image data
Entity-image_data.description: Image data refers to digital representations of visual information, typically in the form of pixels, that can be processed and analyzed by computers.

Entity-experimental_evidence.label: Experimental evidence
Entity-experimental_evidence.description: Experimental evidence refers to data or findings obtained through controlled experiments that support or refute a hypothesis in scientific research.

summary: The automated segmentation of images into semantically meaningful parts requires shape information since low-level feature analysis alone often fails to reach this goal . We introduce a novel method of shape constrained image segmentation which is based on mixtures of feature distributions for color and texture as well as probabilistic shape knowledge . The combined approach is formulated in the framework of Bayesian statistics to account for the robust-ness requirement in image understanding . Experimental evidence shows that semantically meaningful segments are inferred , even when image data alone gives rise to ambiguous segmentations .

Predicate-requires.label: requires
Predicate-requires.description: The predicate 'requires' indicates a necessary condition or resource that the subject must have in order to function, achieve a goal, or complete a process. It establishes a dependency relationship where the subject cannot operate effectively or at all without the object, which represents the essential input, support, or information needed.

Predicate-fails_to_reach.label: fails to reach
Predicate-fails_to_reach.description: The predicate 'fails to reach' indicates a lack of success or achievement in attaining a specified objective or target. It connects the subject, which represents an entity or process, with the object, which denotes the goal or desired outcome that is not accomplished. This relationship highlights a deficiency or shortcoming in the subject's ability to fulfill the expectations associated with the object.

Predicate-is_based_on.label: is based on
Predicate-is_based_on.description: The predicate 'is based on' establishes a foundational relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject derives its principles, concepts, or methodologies from the object. It suggests that the subject is built upon, influenced by, or utilizes the ideas or components represented by the object, thereby highlighting a dependency or source of inspiration.

Predicate-is_formulated_in_the_framework.label: is formulated in the framework of
Predicate-is_formulated_in_the_framework.description: The predicate 'is formulated in the framework of' establishes a relationship where the subject is developed, structured, or conceptualized within the theoretical or methodological boundaries defined by the object. It indicates that the subject is based on, adheres to, or is influenced by the principles, concepts, or systems represented by the object, thereby situating the subject within a specific intellectual or practical context.

Predicate-shows.label: shows
Predicate-shows.description: The predicate 'shows' indicates a relationship where the subject provides evidence, demonstration, or illustration of the object, suggesting that the object is a result, outcome, or manifestation of the subject's characteristics or findings.

Predicate-gives_rise_to.label: gives rise to
Predicate-gives_rise_to.description: The predicate 'gives rise to' indicates a causal or generative relationship between the subject and the object, where the subject is a source or cause that leads to the emergence or occurrence of the object. It implies that the presence or characteristics of the subject contribute to the formation, development, or existence of the object.

Predicate-shows_that.label: shows that
Predicate-shows_that.description: The predicate 'shows that' serves to establish a relationship of evidence or demonstration between the subject and the object. It indicates that the subject provides proof, support, or confirmation for the assertion or claim represented by the object. In this context, the subject is typically a source of information, data, or findings, while the object represents a conclusion, concept, or phenomenon that is being validated or illustrated by the subject.

Predicate-is_a.label: is a
Predicate-is_a.description: The predicate 'is a' establishes a classification or categorization relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject belongs to the category defined by the object. It signifies that the subject can be understood as a specific instance or example of the broader class represented by the object.

skos:broader.label: has a broader term
skos:broader.description: The predicate 'has a broader term' establishes a hierarchical relationship between the subject and the object, indicating that the subject is a specific instance or subset of the more general concept represented by the object. This relationship implies that the object encompasses a wider category or classification that includes the subject, thereby situating the subject within a broader context.
